stg package¶

Submodules¶

stg.project module¶

Created on Apr 3, 2014

@author: Christoph Gollan

class stg.project.Project(pname, pdir, create_dir)¶

Bases: object

A simple project class for managing project files in applications.

Arguments

pname (string):
The name of the project.
pdir (string):
The directory where the project is located.
create_dir (boolean):
Whether or not a directory under the given name should be created.
add_file(filename, sdir=None, create_file=True)¶

Adds a file to a project.

Arguments

filename (string):
The filename that should be added to the project.
sdir (string):
Adds the file to the given sub-directory. If None, it will be added to the default sub-directory (the project’s directory).
create_file (boolean):
Whether or not you want to create the file. Default: True.
Raises: ProjectError
If the sub-directory doesn’t exist or if the file already exists.
add_subdir(sdir, create_dir=True)¶

Adds a sub-directory to the project.

Arguments

sdir (string):
The sub-directory to add.
create_dir (boolean):
Whether or not you want to create the directory. Default: True.
Raises: ProjectError
If the sub-directory already exists or if the project is not a directory.
get_dir()¶

Returns the project’s directory.

Returns: string
get_file_list(sdir=None)¶

Returns the file list to a given directory.

Arguments

filename (string):
The file name.
sdir (string or None):
The sub-directory where the file is located. Default: None.

Returns: list of string

Raises: ProjectError
If the sub-directory doesn’t exist.
get_file_path(filename, sdir=None)¶

Returns the absolute path to a file.

Arguments

filename (string):
The file name.
sdir (string or None):
The sub-directory where the file is located. Default: None.

Returns: string

get_full_name()¶

Returns the absolute path to the project.

Returns: string
get_name()¶

Returns the project name.

Returns: string
get_subdir_path(sdir)¶

Returns the absolute path to a sub-directory.

Arguments

sdir (string):
The sub-directory.

Returns: string

has_file(filename, sdir=None)¶

Checks if the given file exists.

Arguments

filename (string):
The file name.
sdir (string):
The sub-directory where the file should be located. Default: None.
Returns: boolean
If the file exists.
has_subdir(sdir)¶

Checks if the given path exists.

Arguments

sdir (string):
The sub-directory.
Returns: boolean
If the sub-directory exists.
is_dir()¶

Returns True if the project is a directory, otherwise False.

Returns: boolean
remove_file(filename, sdir=None, remove_file=True)¶

Removes a file from the project.

Arguments

filename (string):
The name of the file that should be removed.
sdir (string):
Removes the file from the given sub-directory. If None, it will be removed from the default sub-directory (the project’s directory).
remove_file (boolean):
Whether or not you want to remove the file. Default: True.
Raises: ProjectError
If the file doesn’t exist or if the sub-directory doesn’t exist.
remove_subdir(sdir, remove_dir=True)¶

Removes a sub-directory from the project. The sub-directory has to be empty.

Arguments

sdir (string):
The sub-directory that should be removed.
remove_dir (boolean):
Whether or not you want to remove the directory. Default: True.
Raises: ProjectError
If the sub-directory doesn’t exist or if it’s not empty or if you are trying to remove the project directory.
exception stg.project.ProjectError¶

Bases: exceptions.ValueError

stg.storage module¶

Created on Apr 3, 2014

@author: Christoph Gollan

class stg.storage.Storage¶

Bases: object

A basic storage class for storing objects and read/write files.

get(name)¶

Returns the value for the given name.

Arguments

name (string):
The key name under which the object is accessible.
Returns: object
The object that is stored.
Raises: StorageError
If the key doesn’t exist.
is_stored(name)¶

Checks if the given name is stored.

Arguments

name (string):
The key name under which the object is accessible.
Returns: boolean
Whether there is an entry or not.
static read(filename, method='text')¶

Reads data from a file.

Arguments

filename (string):
The file name where to read from.
method (string):

The method that should be used. Default: text.

Supported are:

Name Description
text Reading a text file
pickle Reading a pickle file
Returns: object
The data that was read.
Raises: StorageError
If the method is not supported.
remove(name)¶

Removes an object from the storage.

Arguments

name (string):
The key name under which the object is accessible.
store(name, obj)¶

Stores an object.

Arguments

name (string):
The key name to access this object.
obj (object):
The object to store.
static write(filename, data, method='text')¶

Writes data to a file.

Arguments

filename (string):
The file name where to write.
data (object):
The data to write.
method (string):

The method that should be used. Default: text.

Supported are:

Name Description
text Writing to a text file
pickle Writing to a pickle file
Raises: StorageError
If the method is not supported.
exception stg.storage.StorageError¶

Bases: exceptions.ValueError
